item.title: Leaking hot water pipes, 27th January
item.description:
Morning Crayford town hall square DA14FH block C pipe are leaking from floor 2 and below . Needs an repair ASAP. Emergency repair required. Regards, Julia

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stadium Way, Crayford, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety lighting off since Netflix filming turned them off, 27th January
item.description:
The safety lights, in the front part of this alleyway open space linking Lensbury Way and Wolvercote Rioad, plus the MUGA lights and LED clock, plus the bridge lights over Wolvercote Road/Yarnton Way were installed and working between summer 2025 and early December, when Film Fixer permitted a crew to film series 2 of a Netflix show in and around Radley House Wolvercote Road and the MUGA. They had their own light rigging and these lights were switched off but never reconnected. It poses risks to women's safety at night, and of mugging. Senior Peabody managers related to Film Fixer have also been made aware. Please switch the circuit back on ASAP. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light in park or open space

item.title: Small section of road is sinking, 27th January
item.description:
There is a small section of the road outside no1 Belmont Avenue which has been slowly sinking. It has not reached a point where due to the way cars are parked on the opposite side of the road to where the issue is it means all road traffic is having to pass over this area now and is likely to cause damage as the issue continues to deteriorate. Issue has been there for sometime now but as I say it is now impacting on driving
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Belmont Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding down to at least 4 houses when raining, 27th January
item.description:
We have continually had to call out the drainage people to drain the water away from our houses .it literally flows down to our houses .this problem is one that needs sorting as it is causing stress and worry . We have tried to get something done even another drainholre would help but today it’s practically flooded already and god knows how bad it will be by later .please send yet another drainage team to at least clear some if it away .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Radnor Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Polystyrene all over road., 27th January
item.description:
Polystyrene all over road, breaking up as vehicles drive over it. Polystyrene is carcinogenic, and it's quickly going all over the road and into the environment. Next to bollard that's been knocked over. I've seen it for the first time this morning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Carlton Parade, Poverest, Orpington, Greater London

item.title: Road needs sweeping, 27th January
item.description:
I reported a problem with Chapmans Lane. Us per usual it was swept to Chapmans End. We the residents of The Cottage,The Planes,The Barn,Chestnut Cottage who live further down the lane also need our part of the lane swept. Why is it a constant battle for us at this part of the lane to get any services without complaining! The amount of mud and leaves on the lane make it extremely dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Star Lane, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
